result.execSummary:
The defendant Constance D Leflore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

per order dated August 13, 2018, Appeal No. 2018XX665, IT IS ORDERED that the deadline for Leflore to file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal in this matter is extended to September 17, 2018.
received and filed.
Received & Filed, Original JURY TRIAL Transcript (80 pages) commencing 12/15/2015 .
Received and Filed.

per order dated May 25, 2018, Appeal No. 2018XX665-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the deadline for Leflore to file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal is extended through the date sixty days after successor counsel is appointed. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.82(2)(a) (2015-16). IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that successor counsel shall advise this court within five days after his or her appointment in this matter. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the state public defender shall provide a copy of this order to successor counsel. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that if successor counsel has not been appointed by July 9, 2018, the state public defender shall, by that same date, file a status report in this court.
Motion to Enlarge the Time Limit to File Notice of Appeal or Postconviction Motion, received.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Constance D Leflore in court with attorney William Francis Sulton.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Jury instruction conference held.  Jury in box at 8:54 am.  Sworn for defense:  Constance L.  Defense rests.  Sworn for state as rebuttal witness: Officer Casey Donahue - MPD.  Jury out of box at 9:20 am.  Arguments heard as to the State's line of questioning.  Jury in box at 9:26 am.  Exhibit 1 offered and received.  Jury out of box at 9:44 am.  In chambers discussion put on record.  Jury in box at 11:14 am.  State rest.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 11:55 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff Deputy Cleveland who was duly sworn for that purpose.  

At the hour of 2:23 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Constance D Leflore in court with attorney William Francis Sulton.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Arguments heard as to the prior convictions of defense witness.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:06 pm.  Jury out of box at 2:40 pm.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn at 2:56 pm.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state: David K and Officer Casey Donahue - MPD.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 3:37 pm.  Defense counsel advised the Court that the defendant will testify.  Court had colloquy with the defendant about her right to testify/not to testify.  Court finds the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives her right to remain silent.  Juror #20 brought into court to discuss knowing Officer Donahue.  Court finds that Juror #20 can be fair and impartial.  Juror #20 returned to the jury room.  Juror #10 brought into court to discuss knowing Officer Donahue.  Court strikes Juror #10 for cause.  Jury in the box at 3:51 pm.  Sworn for defense: Jason S. and Diann L.  Jury released at 4:46 pm for the day and instructed to return at 8:30 am.  Jury trial continued on December 15, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 21.

Defendant Constance D Leflore in court with attorney William Francis Sulton.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

LATER SAME DAY.  SAME APPEARANCES.
CASE RECALLED.

Motions in Limine granted in part and denied in part.  Case adjourned until 12:30 pm for jury trial in Branch 21.

Defendant Constance D Leflore in court with attorney William Francis Sulton.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.   Final pretrial held.   Case remains calendared for jury trial on December 14, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.  Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Constance D Leflore in court with attorney William Francis Sulton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Judge Protasiewizc, Branch 24 is proceeding with another trial.  Judge Havas has taken a spin trial from this court.  Court ordered this case adjourned.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Constance D Leflore in court with attorney William Francis Sulton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

Defendant Constance D Leflore in court with attorney William Francis Sulton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on October 21, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.

Attorney William Francis Sulton in court.  Sara Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case called to address defense motion for an adjournment of the trial date.  Arguments heard.  Court grants defense motion.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Constance D Leflore in court with attorney William Francis Sulton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 245 will be proceeding with another trial.  No other ADA is available.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 24.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Constance D Leflore in court with attorney William Francis Sulton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial.  First call.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.
Defendant Constance D Leflore in court with attorney William Francis Sulton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial held.  Matter to remain on for trial.

Filed:
*  Defedant's Notice of  Motions and Motion in Limine by Constance D Le Flore.

Defendant Constance D Leflore in court with attorney William Francis Sulton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court reiterated the no contact order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-03-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with David K.   AND/OR  Coril G.   AND/OR  their residences    AND/OR  their places of employment

Defendant Constance D Leflore in court with attorney William Francis Sulton.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 24.
